intro: Pavetta nitida, commonly known as the white pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dry fruits that contain several seeds. Pavetta nitida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
